description: Coefficients of the '10th order' mock theta function phi(q)
comments: The alternating sum of the same series, namely phi(q) = sum for n >= 0 of (-1)^n q^(n(n+1)/2)/((1-q)(1-q^3)...(1-q^(2n+1))) = 1+x^3-x^7-x^16+x^24+x^39-x^51-..., where the exponents are given by 5n^2 +/- 2n. See the Amer. Math. Monthly reference.
references: Youn-Seo Choi, Tenth order mock theta functions in Ramanujan's lost notebook, Inventiones Mathematicae, 136 (1999) p. 497-569.
Srinivasa Ramanujan, The Lost Notebook and Other Unpublished Papers, Narosa Publishing House, New Delhi, 1988, p. 9.
American Mathematical Monthly, vol. 107 (2000), p. 569, Answer to Problem number 10681.
crossrefs: Other '10th order' mock theta functions are at A053282, A053283, A053284.
author: _Dean Hickerson_, Dec 19 1999
